title: Announcing a Change in Learning and Public Engagement Leadership
copy: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE April 8, 2022   CHICAGO— Veronica Stein is leaving her role as Woman’s Board Executive Director, Learning and Public Engagement (LPE), and resigning from the Art Institute of Chicago. “My time at the Art Institute has been very special to me, and I am grateful to have worked with such highly committed, talented colleagues who are passionate about making an impact in the lives of learners in Chicago and beyond,” said Ms. Stein who is leaving to pursue other endeavors. During Veronica's period of service, LPE was responsible for leading K–12 school programs and tours, teacher workshops, family programs, and community-based initiatives; the team also worked to relaunch our in-gallery learning opportunities and realize programming in our newly improved and accessible Ryan Learning Center. Veronica headed these museum efforts, promoting participation in art and the museum for visitors and community members of all ages and abilities, fostering critical and creative thinking, and collaborating with partners throughout the city. “On behalf of the Art Institute, I express our deep gratitude for Veronica’s time, effort, and dedication to the museum,” said President and Eloise W. Martin Director James Rondeau. “Her leadership and professionalism are greatly appreciated. The Art Institute thanks her for her service and wishes her the best in her future endeavors.”
